SUSTAINS:
Overall, we had a good throughput in terms of iterations conducted allowing the soldiers to get a lot of repetitions on both day and night training.
The element size used was good for the nature of the training and allowed a good flow in terms of how the training was conducted. IMPROVES:
The training value provided by using UTM rounds was not as good as expected. a. The safety measures required hampered training.
b. Adjudication could have been provided just as easily with Miles gear.
c. It was a common sentiment that blanks would been more effective in terms of allowing greater training value.
d. Use a UTM rounds at times led to breakdowns in the exercise with soldiers more focused on the Gameisms than the actual training event. It would have been good to a concurrent training plan in place for all the soldiers sitting around waiting to go.
We could have made do with less OC's for the training. We often had 5 or 6 OC's when we really only needed 3.
We should have made better use of the ammo we had. We were at times being wasteful in the expenditure of ammo.
Black hornets used. a. We had a ROZ in place and urban operations would have been the perfect opportunity for both BLUFOR and OPFOR to make use of sUAS support.
Better clarity on what we are doing by iteration.

SCHEME OF MANUEVER
Day portion will be a round robin of one squad plus from X PLT conducting the assault, one team plus from Y PLT conducting the defense, and Z PLT observing while leadership acts as OC’s.
The REDFOR element will start in a specified building with the objective of retaining the building.
The BLUFOR element will start from any of the four identified start points with the objective of seizing an occupied building identified to them by their PL via FRAGO.
During the night portion of training Apache Troop will break down into PLT’s and conduct PLT internal training on clearing rooms with a fire team versus balloons and targets.

BASIC CONTROL MEASURES
OPFOR may hide OP’s/rifleman outside of the specified building. These rifleman will disengage in the event they are hit by sim rounds, or they have killed 2 BLUFOR soldiers. Each building will have a safe room. Once BLUFOR has entered inside a 25M ring around the building REDFOR will ceasefire and withdraw into a preidentified safe room where they will remain until ceasefire has been called by OC’s.
They will not engage or be engaged by BLUFOR while they BLUFOR is inside the building they were defending.
Instead, BLUFOR will engage balloon targets while they are clearing the building.
